Package stincmale.ratmex.executor

Class SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService<C extends SubmitterWorkerScheduledTaskConfig<E,SRS,WRS>,E extends SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuredEvent<SRS,WRS>,SRS,WRS>

  • java.lang.Object
    • stincmale.ratmex.executor.SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService<C,E,SRS,WRS>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - A type of scheduled task config used in #scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable, Rate, C).
    E - A type of container with data provided to RateListener by SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService.
    SRS - A type that represents statistics of submitter RateMeter.
    WRS - A type that represents statistics of worker RateMeter.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.concurrent.Executor, java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService, RateMeasuringExecutorService<C,E>

    @ThreadSafe
public class SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService<C extends SubmitterWorkerScheduledTaskConfig<E,SRS,WRS>,E extends SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuredEvent<SRS,WRS>,SRS,WRS>
extends java.lang.Object
implements RateMeasuringExecutorService<C,E>
    This RateMeasuringExecutorService assigns two roles to its threads: submitter and worker. Threads belonging to different roles are organized in two ExecutorService's named submitter and worker. A submitter submits tasks to a worker with the target rate. A worker executes the submitted tasks as fast as it can. If the worker manages to continuously execute all the tasks being submitted without accumulating them, then the tasks are not only being submitted but also are being completed with the target rate.

    Implementation notes
    A submitter always has exactly 1 thread, and a worker may have an arbitrary fixed number of threads including 0 (current-thread executor) and varying number of threads. If a worker has no threads, then a submitter takes over the worker role and executes tasks by itself.

    Submitting tasks by a submitter to a worker means that the submitter and the worker threads communicate. Inter-thread communication is always bad for performance, so it should be reduced to a minimum. In order to do so a submitter organizes tasks in batches before submitting them to a worker. Batching allows submitting multiple tasks to a worker via a single act of communication between a submitter and a worker. However such a technique should be used with caution, because it may induce an uneven load on worker threads and hence lead to a violation of the target rate of completion of tasks. In order to use batching a submitter must know the number of worker threads (which must be fixed) and distribute batched tasks evenly among worker threads.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService

        public SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService​(java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService submitter,
                                                   java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService worker,
                                                   int workerThreadsCount,
                                                   boolean shutdownSubmitterAndWorker)
        This constructor wraps provided submitter and worker thus giving a user the maximum agility and control.
        Parameters:
        submitter - An externally provided submitter. Must have exactly 1 thread. If this constraint is violated, then the behavior is unspecified.
        worker - An externally provided worker. May have an arbitrary number of threads, including 0 (current-thread executor) and varying number of threads. The submitter submits tasks to the worker by using Executor.execute(Runnable).
        workerThreadsCount - The maximum (and the core) number of threads in the worker executor. workerThreadsCount ∈ [-1,Integer.MAX_VALUE]. Use -1 if the number of worker threads is unknown or is varying, but in this case batching of tasks will be disabled. If workerThreadsCount >= 0, then the number of worker threads must never be changed once they all were started. If this constraint is violated, then the RateMeasuringExecutorService may fail to conform to the target rate because of batching. scheduling any task.
        shutdownSubmitterAndWorker - A flag that specifies whether the externally provided submitter and the worker must be shut down when this ExecutorService is shutting down.

      • SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService

        public SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService​(java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory submitterThreadFactory,
                                                   java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory workerThreadFactory,
                                                   int threadsCount,
                                                   boolean prestartThreads)
        This constructor creates submitter and worker threads by using submitterThreadFactory and workerThreadFactory respectively.
        Parameters:
        submitterThreadFactory - A thread factory for submitter threads.
        workerThreadFactory - A thread factory for worker threads.
        threadsCount - A total number of both submitter and worker threads. threadsCount ∈ [1,Integer.MAX_VALUE]. If threadsCount is 1, then the number of worker threads is 0, and the submitter takes over worker role and executes tasks by itself.
        prestartThreads - A flag that specifies if all submitter and worker threads must be started upon the construction of SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService, causing them to idly wait for work. If false, then all threads are started with the first scheduled task.

      • SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService

        public SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService​(int threadsCount,
                                                   boolean prestartThreads)
        This constructor creates submitter and worker threads by using Executors.defaultThreadFactory() and prepends either "submitter-" or "worker-" to each thread name respectively.
        Parameters:
        threadsCount - A total number of both submitter and worker threads. threadsCount ∈ [1,Integer.MAX_VALUE]. If threadsCount is 1, then the number of worker threads is 0, and the submitter takes over worker role and executes tasks by itself.
        prestartThreads - A flag that specifies if all submitter and worker threads must be started upon the construction of SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService, causing them to idly wait for work. If false, then all threads are started with the first scheduled task.

    • Method Detail

      • defaultSubmitterWorkerScheduledTaskConfig

        public static SubmitterWorkerScheduledTaskConfig<SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuredEvent<java.lang.Void,ConcurrentRateMeterStats>,java.lang.Void,ConcurrentRateMeterStats> defaultSubmitterWorkerScheduledTaskConfig​()
        Returns a default SubmitterWorkerScheduledTaskConfig with
        • Default RingBufferRateMeter as submitter rate meter
        • ConcurrentRingBufferRateMeter with modified default ConcurrentRateMeterConfig
          • ConcurrentRateMeterConfig.getMode() - ConcurrentRateMeterConfig.Mode.RELAXED_TICKS
          • ConcurrentRateMeterConfig.isCollectStats() - true
          as worker rate meter.

        Note that despite using ConcurrentRateMeterConfig.Mode.RELAXED_TICKS DefaultSubmitterWorkerRateListener.defaultSubmitterWorkerRateListenerInstance() detects any incorrectly registered ticks by using ConcurrentRateMeterStats thus guaranteeing correctness of all measurements.

      • scheduleAtFixedRate

        public java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> scheduleAtFixedRate​(java.lang.Runnable task,
                                                                   Rate targetRate,
                                                                   C config)
        Description copied from interface: RateMeasuringExecutorService
        Schedules a task to be executed with a fixed rate.

        The repeated execution of the task continues indefinitely until one of the following exceptional completions occur:

        • The task is explicitly cancelled via the returned future.
        • The executor terminates, also resulting in task cancellation.
        • An execution of the task throws a RuntimeException. In this case calling get() on the returned future will throw ExecutionException.
        • The scheduled task times out.
        • The rate listener's method RateListener.onMeasurement(RateMeasuredEvent) returns false, also resulting in task cancellation.
        Subsequent executions are suppressed. Subsequent calls to isDone() on the returned future will return true.
        Specified by:
        scheduleAtFixedRate in interface RateMeasuringExecutorService<C extends SubmitterWorkerScheduledTaskConfig<E,SRS,WRS>,E extends SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuredEvent<SRS,WRS>>
        Parameters:
        config - An additional configuration. Must not be null.

        Method RateListener.onMeasurement(RateMeasuredEvent) is called each time the submitter measures the current submission rate, which in turn happens each time the submitter decides if new tasks need to be submitted to the worker.

        task - A task to schedule for repetitive execution. Must not be null.
        targetRate - A target rate of completion of the task executions. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        A ScheduledFuture representing pending completion of the task. The future's get() method will never return normally, and will throw an exception upon task cancellation or abnormal termination of a task execution.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown​()
        Delegates calls to the submitter and to the worker if and only if those were created by SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService, or were provided externally with enabled shutdownSubmitterAndWorker option.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService

      • shutdownNow

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Runnable> shutdownNow​()
        Delegates calls to the submitter and to the worker if and only if those were created by SubmitterWorkerRateMeasuringExecutorService, or were provided externally with enabled shutdownSubmitterAndWorker option.
        Specified by:
        shutdownNow in interface java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService
        Returns:
        A list that contains combined results from the submitter and the worker, or an empty list if the call was not delegated to them.

      • isShutdown

        public boolean isShutdown​()
        Delegates calls to the submitter and to the worker. Note that if the submitter and the worker were externally provided, then this method may return true even if neither method shutdown() nor shutdownNow() was executed on this object.
        Specified by:
        isShutdown in interface java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService
        Returns:
        true if either the submitter or the worker return true; false otherwise.

      • isTerminated

        public boolean isTerminated​()
        Delegates calls to the submitter and to the worker. Note that if the submitter and the worker were externally provided, then this method may return true even if neither method shutdown() nor shutdownNow() was executed on this object.
        Specified by:
        isTerminated in interface java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService
        Returns:
        true if both the submitter and the worker return true; false otherwise.
